name: Le Meridien Angkor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Generally looks like a typical 5star hotel, with nice pool area, international buffet etc.
reviews.title: Good but noisy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, they appear to have saved on the building costs -- walls are "paper thin" so that every word in adjoining rooms and corridor can be heard.
reviews.title: This is 5 star service

likes.disliked: — Although very close to temples, it's a bit far away from the Siem Reape center

reviews.text: And don't think that the central "garden/Courtyard" will be quieter...those rooms overlook the stage that is used for the band playing at the wedding receptions etc. Yes it was local music...but the drums keep you awake!
reviews.title: Highly Recommended Resort in Siem Reap

reviews.text: This hotel's service is a standout from the rest. A true 5 star hotel, the Bangkok's Royal Meridien in comparison is no match for this very refined hotel in Angkor. We were greeted with refreshing drinks upon arrival...The hotel manager walked us up to our room and made sure everything was done right. We used miles for the rooms and were still welcomed and treated like important guests--this is a sure sign that service is very consistent. The room we stayed at was beautiful and so clean. Every night, someone came and asked if we wanted our beds to be turned down. The staff really made us feel that they cared for us even as we checked out. It is rare to get this type of personal attention at such a large hotel. We had a lovely stay and I would absolutely go back and also recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: Good, but not all positive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Amazing resort staff, huge and beautiful suites, very clean, amazing ambience, best spa massage, etc.
reviews.title: An Amazing Hotel in an Amazing City

reviews.text: I had booked this hotel, through the Starwood website. I must say that I have no regrets in choosing this hotel, especially the fact that we were there, not only to visit angkor wat but also to enjoy family time during my birthday.
reviews.title: A Great hotel in most aspects...

likes.liked: — The room and Le Angelo the italian restraunt

reviews.text: we were picked up from the airport , given cool towels the moment we entered the pick up van. We arrived without any hitch and were directly invited to sit at the lounge while the personnel at reception did all the neccessary.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay at Meridian REP - beautiful hotel, nice people

likes.liked: — Very comfortable, clean, good location; great Tuk-Tuk driver!
likes.disliked: — Food was just so/so, Cab they called for us and internet cost.

reviews.text: The room we booked was a deluxe and it had all the comfort of a good five star hotel. I must say i have no complaints on the room nor the housekeeping service provided at least 3 times a day. My 2.5 daughter was unwell during this trip and had vomitted late evening in the room, and when i called housekeeping, they arrived immediately and cleaned it throughly and infact was so kind that they told me they would spray air freshner once they come back again for housekeeping when we were out for dinner.
reviews.title: Chain Store Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, no complaints on the room service at all, however, what was dissapointing was the same menu buffet breakfast which was served for the 6days we were there, since we were non pork and non beef eater, our spread was very limited. I have travelled to most Starwood hotels and I must say the spread was dissapointing, this is because the Sheraton Laguna in Bali and Sheraton Sukhumvit Bangkok had different spread almost everyday , if not every other day.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having observed this, I must not forget to convey my compliments to the current chef in the Italian restraunt at Le meridien, being a lover of italian food, the chef did justice to italian cuisine. This is a must go restraunt if you ever stay in this hotel. From the entree to the dessert, we were not dissapointed at all. My thanks also to the waiters there, who were so kind in reserving the sofa seat so that my daughter was able to sleep while we had our dinner.
reviews.title: Food poisoning

reviews.text: This place was great. From the front desk, to the tour we booked through the hotel (guide was Sorsom), to the amazing breakfast, to the pool, gym, the room size, and the front lobby. I would stay here if you can afford it. We got a discount and loved the value. Being on tours all day, makes it important to find a nice hotel here to spend the time in the evening and rest.
reviews.title: The best hotel in all of Angkor!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 days and it was not enough time to see all the sites. Let alone enjoy the hotel. I love this area! Take a car to The thousand Linga River and swim in the waterfall. After all the dirty pluted water of all the places along the cesspool that is the Mekon River, it was a delight to be able to swim in clean water! I hate that they make you pay for using the computer to check your e mail. Even the chepest hostel will give this service for free. What is up with all this 4 and 5 star hotel charging? Loved the aromatherapy in the room and the munchies.
reviews.title: Loved the place. Why is the use of internet not free in luxory hotels?

reviews.text: I stayed here at the end of October for two nights. The check in was perfect where I was seated down to register with a drink and cold face towel. It took just a few minutes and I was in the well appointed room, impressively with a 9am early check in without charge.
reviews.title: Business Resort

likes.disliked: — Location and MICE amd group tourists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The whole place is beautiful once you have passed the initial disappointment with the ugly, plain white and red fortress-like building from a distance. The garden and ground are well maintained and peaceful looking,
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.text: The pool is 500 meters from the hotel building which is a bit unstrategic and the vast ground of green carpet grass and palm trees left side of the building is a bit of a waste of land although it looks amazing. The gym is tiny which is unacceptable for a MICE orientated hotels.
reviews.title: just good hotel

reviews.text: I went to Le Meridien Siem Reap with a few of expectativies. However I found an excellent hotel, extremelly friendly staff. It is an old five star hotel, well mainteined, not exclusive, but very good value. fantastic spa.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: I reccomended it !!! Room are wide and warm furnished (a little bit old style)
reviews.title: Lovely Stay, Easy Access to Angkor Wat

reviews.text: Good food, and very close to the temples and the city.
reviews.title: Nice and enjoyable hotel but lacks atmosphere

reviews.text: I will come back!!
reviews.title: Not happy with the Le Meridien Angkor

likes.liked: — Most of the staff was very nice.
likes.disliked: — No Club level/Lounge access.Food, drinks. business services were over-priced for Cambodia.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a Starwood Gold Member and used my points for a four-day, three-night stay at Le Meridien in early February.
reviews.title: classic five stars hotel

aka: Le Meridien Angkor Hotel Siem Reap
description: Being the closest 5 star luxury international hotel to Angkor Wat itself, Le Meridien is the perfect choice for travelers afar, who want to be close to the very reason for visiting. And the rustically colourful township of Siem Reap with its charming French colonial buildings and 400 years old teak trees is just 5 minutes from the hotel where local markets, art galleries and cafes abound.
